results.title: Drinking: how will Charlie handle it?
results.brief_description: The film presents a variety of social and emotional factors which can influence an individual’s decision about drinking. Considers abstinence, drinking in moderation, and a number of consequences of excessive drinking. The film offers no conclusions but is designed to promote thought and discussion about the decision-making process regarding drinking.

results.title: Drinking
results.creator_credit: Joe Licastro, Floyd Elliott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: By alternating live-action sequences and animated graphics, the film follows the behavioral and physiological transformations that are directly linked to consumption of alcohol. It shows the short-term and long-term effects on the human body.

results.title: Drilling a hole in a pin
results.brief_description: Shows the operation and sequences followed when drilling a hole in each end of a steel pin. Two methods are shown: drilling a layout, and drilling with a jig. Explains the reasons for each movement and emphasises various safety precautions.

results.title: Drifters
results.creator_credit: John Grierson and Empire Marketing Board
results.brief_description: The only film ever directed personally by John Grierson. A documentary made for the Empire Marketing Board about the men of the British herring fleets. ‘Drifters’ brought to the screen the labour of the North Sea herring fleet in such a way that the ordinary man or woman was made to realise, perhaps for the first time, that the herring on his plate was no mere accident, but the result of the labour and courage of other men.

results.title: Dressed for the part
results.creator_credit: Ronald Gardner and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: The increasingly important role of safety committees in watching for sources of danger to the worker and seeing that adequate protection is provided. Types of protective clothing for acid handling, welding, lathe work, drum handling and working at heights are shown in use. The film ends with a reminder that while safety committees are doing a good job, their work is ineffective unless the equipment they provide is used by those for whom it was designed.

results.title: The Dreaming
results.creator_credit: Dahl Collings, Geoffrey Collings, Judy Campbell and Collings Productions
results.brief_description: An exploration of Australian First Nations rock paintings in Arnhem Land that attempts to capture the cultural and spiritual significance and meaning of the art to the local peoples.

results.title: A Dream of Norway
results.creator_credit: Ronald Craigen, Edgar H. Anstey, Bergen Line and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: From the moment that the “Leda” sets sail for Bergen, the holidaymaker’s imagination reaches forward to the fjord and mountain roads, glaciers and waterfalls, with Edward Grieg’s “Variations on an old Norwegian romance” to reflect the changing moods of Western Norway.

results.title: Dream of home
results.creator_credit: John Fitchen and Michael Eddowes Films
results.brief_description: A short survey of the life of the well known British poet, Rupert Brooke, who was killed in the first World War. His poems dealt with life, love and above all his love of England. The famous poem “The old vicarage, Grantchester” is spoken and illustrated by views of the countryside, buildings and people of England.

results.title: Dread beat and blood
results.creator_credit: Franco Rosso and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: A unique combination of poetry, music, and politics is portrayed in this film about black reggae musician Lindsay Kwesi Johnson. The lifestyle of blacks in Britain is shown and the pressures they live under. Johnson is seen giving poetry readings in the recording studio as a black activist.

results.title: Drawings that walk and talk
results.creator_credit: K H Frank, Marie Seton, British Film Institute and National Film Archive (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: Traces briefly the history of the animated cartoon. Discusses the purpose of caricature giving an animal a man’s mind and behaviour pattern. Includes excerpts from “Drama Among the Puppets” (France 1908), an Otto Herman treatment (Germany pre 1914), and many others from France, England and America. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: K H Frank, Marie Seton, British Film Institute and National Film Archive (Great Britain)
